pr_title: Generate participations for all exercises in student exams

timeline.message: Created REST Endpoint for generating the participations
Implemented method to pre-start all exercises for student exams
Implemented StartExercise Functionality in the frontend
Implemented reloading after generating student exams / starting exercises

timeline.bodyText: do we only support java atm? I know that @anditurdiu was working on programming exercises in other languages which will come at some point in the future (if not already there). Should the programming language also be configurable?
timeline.author: TobiasPr

replies.bodyText: this is only a test case
replies.author: krusche

timeline.author: krusche

timeline.bodyText:
Please do not use Transactional here and rather use a query such as
studentExamRepository.findWithExercisesAndParticipationsByExamId
Then make sure that only the participations for the user of the student exam is loaded, otherwise your "isEmpty()" check does not make any sense later on
timeline.author: krusche
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -297,4 +302,24 @@ private Exercise selectRandomExercise(SecureRandom random, ExerciseGroup exercis
         int randomIndex = random.nextInt(exercises.size());
         return exercises.get(randomIndex);
     }
+
+    /**
+     * Starts all the exercises of all the student exams of an exam
+     *
+     * @param examId exam to which the student exams belong
+     * @return list of generated participations
+     */
+    @Transactional

replies.bodyText: I'll add comments and we have to improve this later on, but as others need this functionality for testing, we'll merge this now
replies.author: krusche

timeline.bodyText: exercise.getStudentParticipations().isEmpty() is problematic here, because it might include participations of other users than the user specified in the studentExam
timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: I'll add comments and we have to improve this later on, but as others need this functionality for testing, we'll merge this now
